DataElement.preferredName: Wide Range Achievement Test 3 Standardized Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Raw score on the Wide Range Achievement Test Revision 3 (WRAT3) that has been transformed to have a designated mean and standard deviation, to express how far an examinee's score lies from the mean of the distribution in terms of the standard deviation.  Raw scores range from <45 to >155.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Wide Range Achievement Test 3 Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Outcomes from testing a person/subject using the Wide Range Achievement Test Revision 3 (WRAT3), measuring basic skills in reading, arithmetic, and spelling.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Person Wide Range Achievement Test, 3rd Edition
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Person; a human being.:Measures basic skills in reading, arithmetic, and spelling. It is a screening test that can be administered
to determine if a more comprehensive achievement test is needed.

Concepts.definition: Measures basic skills in reading, arithmetic, and spelling. It is a screening test that can be administered to determine if a more comprehensive achievement test is needed.

Property.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Wide Range Achievement Test, 3rd Edition Standard Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition:
Measures basic skills in reading, arithmetic, and spelling. It is a screening test that can be administered
to determine if a more comprehensive achievement test is needed.:Regularly and widely used.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support creation of neuropsychometric tool scoring formats within C3D for the CCR Neuropsychology Division.
